div.sent: Many people have made important contributions towards the achievement of our independence.
He was the Chief Minister of East Bengal during the pre- independence British regime.
For this Sher-e-Bangla is called the Friend of the Farmers.
He worked all his life in the interest of Bengal and the Bangalis.
He worked hard for establishing democracy in Pakistan.
But the Government of Pakistan obstructed him again and again.
He was one of the founder members of Pakistan Awami League.
After the birth of Pakistan he tried to establish democratic system in Pakistan.
Sheikh Mujibur Rahman and many others were inspired by his liberal democratic thinking and ideas.
He was elected Chairman of Muslim Awami League.
He was the founder of the National Awami Party (NAP ).
That is why he is called the Leader of the Oppressed People.
Following the prior instructions of Bangabandhu they organised the Liberation War.
Besides this, Bangladesh was divided in eleven Sectors.
A number of army and civilian officers played important roles during our Liberation War.
He was a very trusted aide of Bangabandhu Sheikh Mujibur Rahman.
Syed Nazrul Islam was bora in January 1925 at his maternal grandfather's home.
His grandfather came from the village Tarapash of Kishoreganj district.
His father was Syed Raisuddin and his mother Nurunnessa Mullik.
Syed Nazrul Islam was a meritorious student.
He passed his Entrance (Matric) Examination from Azimuddin High School, Kishoreganj.
His interest to join politics developed at that time.
Syed Nazrul Islam completed his Masters Degree in History from Dhaka University.
He actively participated in the Language Movement.
He became the President of Awami League in 1966 after Bangabandhu was imprisoned.
In the 1970 election he was elected a member from Mymensingh.
In absence of Bangabandhu, he successfully carried out the responsibility as the Acting President.
After liberation, he was elected Deputy Chief Leader in the Parliament.
Syed Nazrul Islam was an ideal politician.
We shall learn from his life about how to serve the nation.
He was a very honest person, an ideal organiser and a highly meritorious political leader.
The nation will never forget his great contribution in the Liberation War.
His father's name was Moulavi Muhammad Yasin Khan and mother's name was Meherunnessa Khanam.
Tajuddin always stood first in all the school examinations.
He obtained twelfth position and passed in the first division in the Entrance Examination.
He graduated in Law and Economics from Dhaka University.
Tajuddin was a Hafez, too, in the Holy Quran.
Tajuddin Ahmed was involved in politics and social works from his early student life.
Politics and education went hand in hand in his life.
He was one of the founders of the Chhatro League.
Awami League was formed in 1949 and Tajuddin was one of its main founders.
Tajuddin was one of the strategic planners of the famous Six Points Movement.
He was elected the General Secretary of Awami League in 1966.
Tajuddin became an elected member of the then National Assembly in Pakistan.
Tajuddin was very active as an organiser in this Movement.
In the face of extreme hardship for nine months he successfully organised the Liberation War.
After the return of Bangabandhu in Bangladesh on 10 January a new cabinet was formed.
Tajuddin was entrusted with the position of Finance Minister.
He continued with this responsibility upto 1974.
He was brutally killed there with three other national leaders, Syed Nazru!
Islam, Captain Mansur Ali and A H M Qamaruzzaman.
We shall always remember him with love, respect and admiration.
MAG Osmany was the Commander-in-Chief of our Mukti Bahini.
His full name is Mohammad Ataul Ghani Osmany.
He was born on 1 September, 19i8, in Sunamganj.
His father's name was Khan Bahadur Mofizur Rahman.
After finishing his school Osmany got himself admitted in Aligarh University.
He then joined the army and received his Commission in 1940.
He retired from service in 1967, after serving in different positions in Pakistan Army.
After 25 March, 1971, he joined the War of Liberation.
After mis, Mukti Bahini was transformed into a regular Army.
After independence, MAG Osmany was promoted as Chief of Armed Forces of the Bangladesh Army.
He however took retirement from army and soon joined the Government as Cabinet Minister.
He won the election also in 1973 and was taken in as a Minister.
He became a candidate for the opposition alliance in 1978 election for President.
He was a very independent-minded person.
His father's name was Monsur Rahman and mother's name was Jahanara Khatun.
He passed Matric Examination in 1952 from Karachi.
He got himself admitted in D J College, Karachi the same year in IA class.
While serving there, he took part in the Liberation War like other Bangali soldiers.
He was awarded the title Bir Uttam for his contribution in the Liberation War.
Ziaur Rahman introduced Canal Digging Project.
He was also the initiator of SARC.
He will be remembered for his contribution in the War of Liberation of Bangladesh.
